thread.title: Panther boys run all the way to Ft. Dodge
thread.title_full: Panther boys run all the way to Ft. Dodge

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Panther boys run all the way to Ft. Dodge
text:
Panther boys run all the way to Ft. Dodge Oct 23, 2015 Photo by: Josh Dillon Adam Bodenham runs at the regional state qualifying meet on Thursday, in Fairfield. Bodenham finished in fifth place, running the race in 16:29. The Panthers won the race as a team and will be competing at the state meet in Ft. Dodge on Saturday, Oct. 31. 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
FAIRFIELD — The Mt. Pleasant boys’ cross country team is off to state for the third time in school history after a first-place finish in their regional race at Fairfield on Thursday evening. The win was the first ever first-place finish at regionals for Mt. Pleasant. 
The fifth-ranked Panther boys, led by individual winner Logan Murray, scored 57 points, finishing ahead of No. 15 Marion (78 points) and No. 9 Cedar Rapids, Xavier (81 points). The girls’ team was hurt by an injury to top runner Taylor Murray, and finished in 11th. 
L. Murray, who has recently moved up to the No. 1 ranking in 3A boys, dominated the race. He finished in 15:29, a full 27 seconds ahead of second-place Myles Bach of Marion. 
Adam Bodenham and Kyle Vanderham gave the Panthers two top-ten finishes. Bodenham was fifth, in 16:29, and Vanderham was 10th, in 16:53. L. Murray, Bodenham and Vanderham all qualified for state as individuals, to go along with the team qualification. 
Freshman Cody Mertens was the next Panther to cross the finish line. He ran the race in 17:08, for 16th place. Ryan Hutchinson crossed the line in 25th place, in 17:21.70; Dalton Krum was 26th, in 17:22; and Jonathan Ita was 29th place, in 17:24. 
The boys’ team advances to the state meet at Lakeside Municipal Golf Course in F.t Dodge on Saturday, Oct. 31. The boys’ 3A race is scheduled to start at 12:30 p.m. 
T. Murray suffered a knee injury late in the girls’ race. She was running in 20th, just five spots away from a state qualifying spot, when she was forced to pull out of the race. 
Delaney McDowell ran in 31st place with a finishing time of 20:55.10, to lead the Mt. Pleasant runners. Kelsey Notestein came in 54th place, running in 22:09.20. 
A pack of Panthers finished in places 75-78. Catherine Prough was 75th, in 25:49.70; Emma Smith was 76th, in 25:58.10; Ally Davis was 77th, in 25:58.49; and Megan Shumaker was 78th, in 25:58.49. 
BOYS’ TEAM SCORES
